answers.answer: He could have a 6th nerve palsy, (side to side double vision)  3rd nerve palsy (droopy eyelid and side to side and up and down double vision) or 4th nerve palsy (mostly up and down double vision.)  All can be caused by poor circulation and hardening of the arteries as well as diabetes.  Rarely something like a stroke or tumor or neurologic diseases can aslo cause it.  An ophthalmologist should be able to see you and answer all your specific questions.MJK MD
